DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Blood Specimen Reverse Transcriptase-Polymerase Chain Reaction Outcome Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the normalized quotient value for the result of the medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood using reverse transcriptase-polymerase chain reaction (RT-PCR), a technique in which an RNA strand is first transcribed into a DNA complement and then subjected to PCR amplification.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Blood Specimen Reverse Transcriptase-Polymerase Chain Reaction Outcome
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the result of the medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood using reverse transcriptase-polymerase chain reaction (RT-PCR), a technique in which an RNA strand is first transcribed into a DNA complement and then subjected to PCR amplification.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: Blood circulating throughout the body.:A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.:RT-PCR is short for reverse transcriptase-polymerase chain reaction. It is a technique in which an RNA strand is first transcribed into a DNA complement and then subjected to PCR amplification. Transcribing an RNA strand into a DNA complement is termed reverse transcription and is done by the enzyme reverse transcriptase. (from Wikipedia):Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

Concepts.definition: A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

A laboratory procedure in which an RNA strand is first transcribed into a DNA complement and then subjected to PCR amplification. Transcribing an RNA strand into a DNA complement is termed reverse transcription and is done by the enzyme reverse transcriptase.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Reverse Transcriptase Polymerase Chain Reaction Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the normalized quotient value, the target gene divided by the housekeeping gene, after Reverse Transcriptase Polymerase Chain Reaction (RT-PCR).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
